description.raw:
Several tests are failing on the [homebrew build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/BuildCopFail/job/ignition_rndf-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/8/testReport/), and they appear to be related to the `Remove*` functions in various classes. The documentation says these functions should return true if something was removed and false otherwise. For each of these functions, I split the big `return` statement into several statements to ensure the order of operations, since the `end()` function is evaluated multiple times in the statement, but also changes after the removal, so it's important to cache that value first. The homebrew tests pass for me with these changes.

I also saw that the windows builds is failing, so I'm attempting to modify the configure script to match what we do in [sdformat](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/src/sdf5/configure.bat?fileviewer=file-view-default).

Several tests are failing on the homebrew build, and they appear to be related to the Remove* functions in various classes. The documentation says these functions should return true if something was removed and false otherwise. For each of these functions, I split the big return statement into several statements to ensure the order of operations, since the end() function is evaluated multiple times in the statement, but also changes after the removal, so it's important to cache that value first. The homebrew tests pass for me with these changes.

I also saw that the windows builds is failing, so I'm attempting to modify the configure script to match what we do in sdformat.

title.raw: Fix Remove functions and windows build
